column4: Coinstar shares rise on Redbox-Verizon partnership report
column5: Shares of Coinstar Inc jumped 11 percent after media reports that the kiosk maker's Redbox rental service is partnering with Verizon Communications for a new online streaming service.

column4: CME lowers margin requirements for Crude Oil  Heat Oil futures
column5: Dec 8 The CME Group  parent of the Chicago Board of Trade  on Thursday lowered margins for Crude Oil Future NYMEX (CL) and Heating Oil Futures NYMEX (HO).

column4: Illinois House leaders reach deal to keep CME  Sears
column5: CHICAGO Illinois House leaders have agreed to pass tax breaks to keep the CME Group and Sears Holdings from leaving the state  the minority leader said on Thursday.

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 1-Comtech Q1 profit halves  shares fall
column5: Dec 8 Comtech Telecommunications Corp's  quarterly profit nearly halved in the first quarter  hurt by a sharp decline in demand at its mobile data communications unit  sending its shares down by 5 percent in extended trading.

column4: UPDATE 2-Conn's boosts spending to drive holiday sales
column5: Dec 8 Electronics and home appliances retailer Conn's Inc said it is ramping up advertising and hiring to drive sales in the holiday season  sending its shares to their highest in more than two years.

column4: Costco shares fall as margins shrink
column5: (Reuters)- Costco Wholesale Corp  posted a quarterly profit in line with Wall Street's expectations  but shares of the largest U.S. warehouse club operator fell as margins dropped more than expected.

column4: UPDATE 1-Costco Wholesale Q1 profit rises
column5: Dec 8 Costco Wholesale Corp  posted a higher quarterly profit  helped by strong gasoline prices and membership fees.

column4: Unions sue to block Washington state liquor privatization
column5: SEATTLE Unions representing 1 000 Washington liquor store workers sued to stop the voter-approved closure of state-run liquor shops set to begin on Thursday.

column4: Metaio opens AR platform to chipmakers  developers
column5: Dec 8 Metaio  one of the leaders in augmented reality (AR) technology  on Thursday opened its platform to chipset vendors and software developers for free  hoping to boost its position in the emerging sector.

column5: Dec 8 Microsoft Corp said on Thursday it has opened a new global delivery centre in southern Indian city of Bangalore to support its clients in more than 65 countries.

column5: General Electric Co and Microsoft Corp are forming a joint venture to develop and sell software systems to make it easier for healthcare providers to  store  access and share patient information.

column4: UPDATE 1-BCE ups dividend  announces share buyback
column5: Dec 8 BCE Inc  Canada's largest telecom company  raised its dividend for 2012 by about 5 percent to C$2.17 per share and said it will buy back up to C$250 million ($247.1 million) of shares.

column4: China's "Best Buys" scramble to tap e-commerce boom
column5: HONG KONG Two Chinese appliance and electronics retailers  regarded by some as the country's answers to Best Buy Co Inc   are racing to beef up their e-commerce arms and tap the booming but highly competitive online retail market.

column4: China's 'Best Buys' scramble to tap e-commerce boom
column5: * Retailers aim for e-commerce to make up large part of sales

column4: BHP job changes  CEO comments  fan talk of asset sales
column5: SYDNEY Management changes at BHP Billiton and comments by CEO Marius Kloppers have fanned speculation the world's biggest miner will try to sell less profitable assets to better exploit its crown jewels -- iron ore  coal  copper  gas and potash.

column4: REFILE-BHP job changes  CEO comments  fan talk of asset sales
column5: SYDNEY  Dec 8 Management changes at BHP Billiton and comments by CEO Marius Kloppers have fanned speculation the world's biggest miner will try to sell less profitable assets to better exploit its crown jewels -- iron ore  coal  copper  gas and potash.

column4: Boeing eyes remaining aircraft orders in U.S. spree
column5: Boeing Co   on track to notch its highest number of commercial aircraft orders since 2007  is working to bag what many experts say are the last available orders in a buying spree by U.S. operators.

column4: UPDATE 1-Boeing  Air Lease close $1.2 billion order
column5: Dec 8 Boeing Co and Air Lease Corp  said on Thursday they finalized an order worth $1.2 billion  for four 787-9 Dreamliners and four Next-Generation 737-800s.

column4: UPDATE 1-Boeing machinists union ratifies labor pact
column5: Dec 7 Boeing Co's  biggest labor union on Wednesday ratified a four-year contract extension  ensuring the upcoming version of the planemaker's best-selling 737 narrowbody will be built in Washington state and likely ending Boeing's high-profile dispute with the National Labor Relations Board.

column4: UPDATE 1-Boeing nearing deals with FedEx  Southwest-reports
column5: Dec 7 Boeing Co is nearing two separate deals with world's No. 2 package delivery company FedEx Corp and discount carrier Southwest Airlines Co   according to media reports.

column4: Boeing union members line up to vote on contract
column5: Members of Boeing Co's biggest labor union began voting on Wednesday on a four-year contract extension  which if ratified could end the planemaker's dispute with the National Labor Relations Board and ensure the upcoming version of the best-selling 737 narrowbody will be built in Washington state.

column4: Boeing nears deals with FedEx  Southwest: reports
column5: Boeing Co is nearing two separate deals with world's No. 2 package delivery company FedEx Corp and discount carrier Southwest Airlines Co  according to media reports.

column4: Oil dragged down by ECB comments; eyes EU summit
column5: NEW YORK Crude oil futures fell for a second straight day on Thursday as disappointing comments from the head of the European Central Bank increased doubts among investors that the region's debt crisis will be contained.

column4: Trafigura unit buys Caribbean assets from Chevron
column5: Dec 8 Puma Energy  a unit of Europe-based commodities trading giant Trafigura  said on Thursday it agreed to buy Caribbean region fuel distribution and storage assets from U.S. oil major Chevron   in a bid to expand its presence in the region.

column4: UPDATE 1-Keyera to buy iso-octane facility for $198 mln
column5: Dec 8 Canada's Keyera Corp said it will buy Alberta EnviroFuels  an iso-octane manufacturing business jointly owned by subsidiaries of Finland's Neste Oil Oyj and Chevron Corp  for $198 million.

column4: Singapore Refining Co cuts output on poor margins - sources
column5: SINGAPORE  Dec 8 Singapore Refining Company  a joint venture between Singapore Petroleum Company and Chevron Corp  has reduced the utilisation rate at its refinery due to poor margins  two sources close to the company said on Thursday.

column4: TEXT-S&P revises Chunghwa Telecom otlk to negative; rtgs afrmd
column5: -- Increasing regulatory pressure on Taiwan-based incumbent telecom operator  Chunghwa Telecom Co. Ltd. (CHT)  to reduce its tariff's has been weakening the operator's profit margins.

column4: Japan regulators to seek punishment for Citigroup unit: report
column5: Japan's regulator Securities and Exchange Surveillance Commission will ask the Financial Services Agency (FSA) to punish Citigroup Global Markets Japan Inc for trying to manipulate a short-term interest rate benchmark  the Nikkei business daily reported.

column4: Coca-Cola moves secret soft drink formula to public vault
column5: Coca-Cola Co moved the 125-year-old secret formula for its soft drink to its hometown attraction  the World of Coca-Cola  where it will be housed permanently for the public to view.

column4: Shell  Conoco  Repsol increase Alaska oil holdings
column5: ANCHORAGE  Alaska  Dec 7 Royal Dutch Shell on Wednesday acquired exploration rights to state territory off Alaska's northern coast  while ConocoPhillips increased holdings on both state and federal lands on the North Slope.

column4: Anarchist group may have sent letter bomb: German police
column5: FRANKFURT An Italian anarchist group has claimed responsibility for a letter bomb sent to Josef Ackermann  chief executive of Deutsche Bank  and may have sent two more packages  investigators said on Thursday. | Video

column4: Anarchist group claims letter bomb: German police
column5: FRANKFURT German investigators said Thursday they had obtained a letter written in Italian in which a group calling itself the Informal Anarchist Federation claimed responsibility for a letter bomb sent to Josef Ackermann  head of Deutsche Bank.

column4: UPDATE 3-Package sent to banker was bomb -German police
column5: * No claim of responsibility  Occupy movement condemns action   (Adds quotes from police  experts  bank insider)

column4: UPDATE 2-Package sent to banker was bomb -German police
column5: * No claim of responsibility  Occupy movement condemns action   (Updates with confirmation of bomb)

column4: German police: package sent to banker was letter bomb
column5: BERLIN  Dec 8 German police said on Thursday a suspicious envelope sent to Deutsche Bank  Chief Executive Josef Ackermann and intercepted on Wednesday was a letter bomb capable of exploding  an initial examination showed.

column4: UPDATE 2-Deutsche Bank CEO target of suspicious envelope-police
column5: FRANKFURT  Dec 7 An envelope containing explosives was sent on Wednesday to the head of Deutsche Bank  Josef Ackermann -- known as the face of capitalism in Germany -- but it was intercepted before it reached him  a banking source and a U.S. law enforcement official said.

column4: More troops' ashes dumped in landfill  Washington Post says
column5: WASHINGTON The Air Force dumped the remains of more U.S. troops in a Virginia landfill then it had previously acknowledged  the Washington Post reported on Thursday.

column4: Med Crude-Urals supported by ENI bid  Bosphorus
column5: LONDON  Dec 8    Differentials on Russian Urals held steady in the Mediterranean on Thursday  partly supported by the congested ship traffic in the Bosphorus strait.	     In Northwest Europe  Unipec reappeared to offer 100 000 tonnes  knocking its offer level.	     Unipec  the trading arm of Sinopec  offered 100 000 tonnes of Urals for Dec. 27-31 at dated Brent plus 20 cents a barrel in NWE. 	     On Tuesday  Unipec offer the same volume for Dec. 25-29 at dated plus 30 cents.	     So

column4: Iran still owes Eni nearly $2 billion in oil-CEO
column5: DOHA  Dec 8 Italian energy major Eni  hopes nearly $2 billion of Iranian crude it is still owed by the National Iranian Oil Company would be exempt from any possible EU ban on buying Iranian oil  ENI's chief executive said on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 1-EQT to form natural gas transmission MLP
column5: * To form MLP engaged in interstate natural gas transmission

column4: Exxon Mobil sees global CO2 emission peak in 2030
column5: Carbon dioxide emissions from energy sources will rise until 2030  when they will level off as fuels such as natural gas replace dirtier supplies of coal  Exxon Mobil said on Thursday.

column4: Big Oil says to clean up shale gas business
column5: DOHA  Dec 8 Big oil and gas companies say their increasing dominance of shale gas exploration will bring improved drilling practices and should end the safety lapses that have led to environmental opposition to the fast-growing  multi-billion dollar industry.

column4: Exxon sees gas replacing coal as top U.S. power generator - WSJ
column5: Dec 8 Natural gas will replace coal as the leading fuel for generating electricity in the United States by 2025 due to its easy availability and a drive for cleaner-burning energy  the Wall Street Journal said  citing the latest long-term outlook from Exxon Mobil Corp.

column4: UPDATE 1-Boeing nearing deals with FedEx  Southwest-reports

column5: DETROIT Ford Motor Co  restored its dividend for the first time in five years on Thursday  with a quarterly payout of 5 cents per share that the No. 2 U.S. automaker said it could maintain during any future downturn.

column4: EDF and GE Energy to develop new gas turbine
column5: PARIS  Dec 8 EDF has partnered GE Energy to develop a new generation of combined cycle gas turbine (CCGT) as part of the French utility's aim to modernise its fleet of thermal power plants  the French state-owned utility said in a statememt.

column5: LONDON Nokia  is to sell its luxury subsidiary Vertu  as the Finnish handset manufacturer overhauls its business to compete with other smartphone makers  the Financial Times reported on Thursday.

column4: RLPC-SAP to repay loan for SuccessFactors with cashflow
column5: LONDON  Dec 8 German business software company SAP's 1 billion euro ($1.33 billion) loan to back its acquisition of cloud computing firm SuccessFactors Inc  is expected to be repaid quickly by SAP's free cashflow  banking sources said on Thursday.

column5: NEW YORK Just days before one of the most anticipated jewelry sales in years  an auction of diamonds  sapphires and other gems produced middling results.

column4: Publicis lands Sprint advertising deal
column5: PARIS  Dec 8    Sprint  the No.3 U.S. mobile provider  said on Thursday it awarded a global advertising contract to Digitas  a unit French advertising group Publicis.

column4: Total's Alberta oil sands project gets approved
column5: CALGARY  Alberta The Canadian government gave Total SA approval on Thursday to start construction on its C$9 billion ($8.9 billion) Joslyn North oil sands project in Alberta  marking the fifth mining development in the vast crude deposit.

column4: Uganda hopes to be able to approve Tullow deal by Jan
column5: NEW DELHI  Dec 8 Approval for Tullow Oil's  sale of some of its Ugandan assets to CNOOC  and Total could come before the end of January if the company furnishes details about the deal within two weeks  Uganda's oil minister said on Thursday.

column4: Taiwan's UMC Nov sales fall 22.75 pct on year
column5: TAIPEI  Dec 8 Taiwan's UMC  the world's No.2 contract chipmaker  said on Thursday its November sales fell 22.75 percent from a year earlier.

column4: Coinstar shares rise on Redbox-Verizon partnership report
column5: Shares of Coinstar Inc jumped 11 percent after media reports that the kiosk maker's Redbox rental service is partnering with Verizon Communications for a new online streaming service.

column4: Wal-Mart files plan for share sale by Waltons
column5: Wal-Mart Stores  disclosed an agreement on Thursday to sell more than 70 million shares of the world's largest retailer by a firm controlled by members of the founding Walton family.

column4: Wachovia agrees to $148 million pact with SEC  states
column5: Wachovia Bank  owned by Wells Fargo & Co  agreed to pay $148 million in a settlement with federal and state authorities over allegations of bid-rigging and other abuses in the municipal bond derivatives market.

column4: Liquidity twist on bank liability management
column5: LONDON  Dec 8 (IFR) - Wells Fargo and Yorkshire Building Society joined the bulging liability management pipeline on Thursday  although unlike recent exercises conducted by European banks  they cited liquidity as the rationale for their deals.
